headline: Grandmother's Pound Cake
description: This traditional pound cake recipe is made with the original formula of 1 pound each of butter, sugar, eggs and flour for a moist, dense dessert.

video.description: This recipe is over 100 years old and is the original kind of pound cake: it contains 1 pound each of butter, sugar, eggs, and flour and contains no salt, baking powder, or flavoring.
video.name: How to Make Grandmother's Pound Cake II

name: Grandmother's Pound Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease three 8x4-inch loaf pans, then line with parchment paper.

Cream together sugar and butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Beat in flour alternately with milk, mixing just until incorporated. Pour batter evenly into the prepared loaf pans.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cakes comes out clean, about 70 minutes.
Run a small knife around the edges of each pan. Allow cakes to cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then invert, peel off the parchment, and cool completely on wire racks.

review.reviewBody: Awesome recipe. I made it as told. Beautiful. Made a little apple brown sugar simple syrup for the top. Heavenly
Added extra ingredients came out great
I've made this many times. It is always a favorite, and asked for by friends and family at every visit.

Great pound cake!! Very buttery!! I did as the reviewers stated and mixed the butter and sugar for 10 minutes, then each egg for 1 minute each, added a Tbs of vanilla after the eggs, substituted heavy cream for the milk and only beat the alternating flour/cream just until combined.
I have made this 4 times in the past 2 months. Family keeps requesting it. Fabulous recipe. Try adding a little lemon or orange zest!

My family is madly in love with this cake!! It's divine! Thank you to the other commenters for your helpful advice! I made this with the following additions/changes: 1. I added 2+ Tbsp vanilla. 2. I used freshly milled flour = soft, white wheat, ground on the pastry setting. The cakes were light and delicious!

I beat the heck out of this at each addition as recommended, thinking this would lighten the end result... however, though it was tasty, certainly heavy... I served it with homemade coffee yogurt with Frangelica & whipped cream...yum

This makes a perfect, classic American pound cake: no pizzazz, just cake. The texture is dense, the flavor buttery, and it is ideal to be eaten with macerated berries and whipped cream. This is one of the literal simplest recipes any baker could make; I had my 11 year old follow it, with my 4 year old making the measurements, and loosely supervised/directed. I even baked it in different loaf pans, one glass, one nonstick, one stoneware. All still came out perfect. I don't know what the people are doing who are having trouble, but I applaud their effort.

Made this last night. Came it beautifully. Was delicious and moist! I did add a teaspoon of vanilla and a teaspoon of lemon extract, then topped with a lemon glaze. I have a lemon poundcake addiction. Only issue is I would have preferred a softer, moister bake around the edges.

This turned out really well for me! I added 1 tbsp vanilla, 1/2 tsp almond extracts, sprinkled a little cinnamon and a pinch of salt. Sifted the flour and beat the out of the butter and sugar, until light and fluffy. Initially baked at 350, but noticed it turning dark, so I lowered the temp. It burned a little on top, but that could also be due to baking it in my toaster oven. This will be my go-to recipe for sure!!
came out PERFECT! Was fantastic.

Made it as directed. Put it in a Bundt pan and cooked it until a knife came out clean. Don’t ask what temp or time cause I forgot. I didn’t have any loaf pans. However, my family loved it!!! Awesome awesome awesome thanks for sharing.

great pound cake! i made it for my mom and she loved it. the only changes i made were adding an extra 1/2 cup milk, and i only baked it for about an hour. the loaves came out great and it was a good density!

It was horrible, just baked custard
Didn't form the shape, it was just sweetened egg that was baked
Wonderful we loved it
This is a classic perfect recipe as is. I used (2) 9x5 loaf pans and baked for 1 hour and 10 minutes. So delicious with a golden crust and a fluff texture inside.

OMG - Absolutely delicious! The only changes I made was to halve the recipe and then add 2 tsp lemon extract (3-4 tsp would be even better) between the egg and flour step. I used a 9×6 loaf pan that turned out to be too small! I assumed that without baking soda this wouldn't rise much but it surprisingly did. I cooked at 325° for 80 minutes. Next time I'll bake at 350° in a larger pan and that should reduce the baking time. Because of the high butter content the toothpick test isn't very effective, I removed from oven when center was no longer jiggly and had firmed up. Definitely beat the butter and sugar for at least 10 minutes, an additional 2 minutes with each egg addition and then the bare minimum after you add your flour and milk. So buttery with a light lemon flavor and a nice sweet crust. It didn't even need a glaze!

This recipe is exactly what I was looking for. Came out perfect and it’s easy to modify based on my flavoring needs. (I couldn’t submit the photo to go with it from my iPad but please know it’s absolutely perfect!)
If you switch out flavorful butter with neutshortening or oil, then, you are switching out flsv
Great recipe!! Thanks to the suggestions in the reviews, it made it easier to make this DELICIOUS pound cake!
Turned out great except I would turn the temperature down if you are doing 3 loaf pans! My cake got nice and brown, but sunk after taking it out. Still delicious though! i will be making this again!
Wonderful recipe! Tastes like my grandmother's pound cake. I used a little extra milk and cooked it in a bundt pan. I will definitely keep the recipe for future use.
Great recipe- no sour cream or cream cheese- the way the recipe was intended!
I cooked the full recipe in a bundt pan. It took well over an hour and a half.
I just pulled these out the oven and it’s so good I might just adjust the cooking time over all a great recipe
I haven’t made it yet but does the butter need to be room temperature or melted

Great recipe! I made this for my family and everyone who ate a slice loved it. The color, texture, and taste were perfect! This recipe only made 2 loaf pan cakes for me rather than 3, but perhaps I filled each one fuller than the recipe writer?? Whatever the reason, there was more than enough. This recipe is for a true pound cake and I will definitely make it again!
Texture is perfect! I added powdered vanilla bean because I love that pop of flavor

Wanted to try a different pound cake recipe because the one I was using was never consistent and the taste wasn't quite a pou d cake. First time making this and it was a perfect, true pound cake! Served it with a dollup of homemade whipped cream and family loved it! Will be my go to pound cake recipe from now on.
Love love love! Light and fluffy so easy for a teenage sleepover party! decorative would be easy! looks awesome and tastes like a loaf of heaven! I would use 9” by 5” pans.
I adjust the servings down by half since it's only me and my husband, but I've made this multiple times and it comes out great every time. Easy and tasty, best combination.
Amazing recipe! The cake was so soft and moist. I topped it with fresh black raspberries and a elderflower lavender simple syrup, making it one of the best cakes I've had.
so so good. I replaced half a stick of butter with applesauce and you can't tell at all. second time I made them I cut out a whole stick of butter and added frozen blueberries. delicious!

As others suggested I made sure everything was at room temperature, and followed the beat it to death and add just one egg at a time rule?. I have a large heavy duty Nordic Ware Bundt pan and it fit perfectly in that. I baked it at 3:50° For about 75 minutes. I think next time I’ll turn the oven down to 325 as it got a little too brown by the time the inside was done. Even so the cake was moist and really perfect. Strawberry Shortcake never tasted so dang good!
Second time making this! Came out well! But i will reduce the sugar next time.
The easiest and best pound cake I have ever made!! Thank you!!!

I made the recipe version in the magazine. It tastes amazing but....it took forever to get done! I started out at 50 minutes and it was no way near done. I kept adding 10 minutes until it finally tested done. It took 95 minutes!!! My oven does bake at a correct temperature, as I have checked it and nothing else that I bake have I ever had this problem with
The taste and texture are great. I added a little vaniilla and almond extracts! Delicious!
I have been searching for a good pound cake recipe and finally found one! Thank you. Add whatever flavor extract you want. I have used vanilla and almond. Will try lemon next time.

I made this cake today and I believe it's the best pound cake I've ever put in my mouth! Of course being from the south, I had to add a cup of roasted chopped pecans and a half teaspoon of almond extract. I was going to top it with fresh strawberries and whip cream, but it was sooooo good just with a cup of coffee I left them for later.
Very simple and very good!

Edit to my review: Please stick to the baking time. Even though I made it for 10 servings the baking time still was 70 minutes. My recommendation is to start checking at the 50 minute mark if you use a small 6" fluted tube pan. Then, continue baking at 10 minute increments. If the surface is browned but the cake is still raw inside, cover it with aluminium foil and continue baking at the stated increments. I served this cake with a cherry filling/compote on the side. It was delicious!!! Wi
So yummy - tastes better than store bought! I lowered the serving count to 10 so I only made one pan and added a teaspoon of vanilla extract.
I have made this 3 times. It is the best pound cake recipe! I add strawberries and peaches , fresh home made whipped topping...divine
I made the recipe exactly as written. It was very dense, dry and little taste. Too bad

I modified using the suggestion of adding some vanilla and almond extract. The almond added a wonderful taste. I made 2 batches, one using mini loaves at 350 for 50 minutes. The inner consistency was good, the outer portion is a little crisp (not burnt).... I don’t think due to user error. The regular loaf batch was in for only 65/70 and was burnt on the outside.... this was due, in part, to user error, I was unable to check on it between the 45&65 minute mark. Bummer. May make again.
Delicious receipe! Easy to make! Loved it!
This recipe came out absolutely delicious. It was the bomb.com. I added an additional two eggs, vanilla extract, orange extract, and lemon.

This was excellent! I cut the recipe in half (15 servings) and made one loaf in a 9x5 pan. I creamed the butter and sugar for 10 minutes and beat each egg for two minutes after adding, as suggested by other reviews. I also used one teaspoon of vanilla. It took 70 minutes to cook. It was delicious.

I took others' suggestions and added 2tsp vanilla to the batter. Then, I divided the batter into three bowls to make three flavors. One got an extra tsp vanilla, one got a tsp of almond extract, and one got the zest and juice of one lemon plus a lemon glaze. The lemon loaf was beautiful, but the almond loaf was my favorite. They baked in 50-55 minutes--definitely check them well before the 70 minute mark.
Excellent easy cake. I add about 1 tsp vanilla and scant 1/2 tsp salt to half the recipe and bake in one 9” X 5” pan for about 50 minutes. Never fails.
Grandma's pound cake turned out beautifully, baked to a perfect golden brown. A little on the sweet side for my taste. Next time I'll reduce the sugar by a little. What a great pound cake.

I had been craving a homemade pound cake for a long time. I would buy the ones at the grocery store only to be disappointed with the taste. I finally decided I'll try to make one myself and found this recipe. It was exactly the taste I was looking for! My husband and son loved it as well. I definitely will make it again.
Idk what I did wrong— but this turned out as a brick for me. I followed the recipe to a T.
Amazing!!! We loved it.
It was really good. Made 10 servings not 30. It turned out great.
Made this multiple times. A definite hit.
So easy and deliciously moist.
Great classic pound cake recipe. Made exactly as stated. The cake has a nice crumb and a dense, full flavor. I served it plain, but bet it would be good with berries and cream as well.
Everyone loved it
Best pound cake recipe ever! The only change that i made is to decrease the heat to 325 and add almond extract. I've had nothing but compliments about this cake.
I made muffins for strawberry shortcakes. I baked them in 350 for 20 minutes, and they came out wonderful!!

Didn’t change a single ingredient, but halves the recipe. Had to bake my 9x5 loaf pan for about 80 minutes. Dense, not-too-sweet, with an awesome “crust” and fantastic with homemade whipped cream and raspberries! Made a loaf on Friday and making another for my daughter’s teacher appreciation lunch on Monday.

The pound cake just came out of the oven...looks beautiful...looking forward to tasting it tomorrow... too late to indulge. Thanks, from a grandmother who loves to bake, for sharing this recipe. 
Shirley

I was looking for a good recipe for a pound cake like my Mom used to make. Since she used to back from memory I had no recipe to go by. Thank you for sharing this one! Delicious and my family loved it. Only thing I added was some vanilla extract
This was an absolute disaster! Tastes like sweet bread. Try a different recipe.
Simple. Easy. Basic. Next time I will add vanilla. Cooking time was 1 hour and 20 minutes in a temperature oven.
My whole family enjoyed it, so I'm definitely going to make it again.
It turned out great! I later added chocolate icing after and added chocolate chips after I put it in my Bundt pan. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a great cake recipe!
It's simple and supper easy to make, the whole family love it.

I adjusted the portions from 30 to 10 because I only needed one loaf. This is the best pound cake my husband and I have ever had. The first loaf was gone and he had to go on a road trip and he asked me to make another so he could snack on it during the trip. I highly recommend this recipe. Also, I live at 5400 ft. and did not make any high altitude adjustments for ingredients. Just keep an eye on your baking time, not sure if mine was less because of my oven or my altitude.
Have made this recipe a few times and it has always been great. Simple to do turns out very moist and is one of the best pound cakes.
LOVE THIS RECIPE

I used a tspn of almond extract. 
It came out great!

Thank you for the recipe!
I made this cake and brought it to our church’s potluck lunch. It was a hit and not a crumb was left! They were asking for more!

I also whipped up a cup of powdered sugar with two tablespoons of milk and a teaspoon of cinnamon for a glaze.
Great Recipe! Cake is delicious!
Yes it's a good recipe. So simple. Took me back to the old flavor of many years ago.
Yummy!!!!!!!

I want to say 1st that I do not like pound cake!!! I made it for my God mother because she requested one and I like to back. I came on this website searching for a repicie and I chose this one. I read all the reviews and after a few alterations, this cake was delicious even for me. My alterations were: I preheated my oven to 325 degrees. I used 2 loaf pans instead of a bundt pan. Eggs and butter must be room temperature! I used one cup of brown sugar and 2 cups of white and creamed with the butter for literally 20min ( I set a timer). Add one egg at a time, 1 min apart. I used 1/2 tablespoon of pure vanilla and 1/2 tablespoon of almond extract. I also put in 1/4 tablespoon of lemon extract. I used cake flour instead of all purpose flour and sifted 3 times before adding in with heavy whipping cream instead of milk. I baked for about an hour. I waited until it completely cooled. Cake came out light brown, full flavored, and delicious.

Turn out great! Per other reviews I used Cake flour in place of all-purpose, 8 Eggs, 1 cup of heavy whipping cream and 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract. I used 3 loaf pans cooking on 350 for about 50 to 55 minutes.
Awesome! Perfection
This recipe is so so so so so so good!! I have made this recipe 2 times now and I know I’m gonna make it again!
Loved it! Exactly what I wanted. A simple plain pound cake.

I didn’t change a thing (just added vanilla extract) and it came out perfect!! 
I made a loaf cake instead....10 servings instead of 30.
It’s perfect on it’s own. Next time I want to maybe add some raisins and nuts to it or go lighter with some kind of fruit in there or add icing to it. I’ve so many plans with this cake lol
My cake came out dense , and pound cake is supposed to be smooth inside.
This was a success for me on the first try! My family devoured it! I decided to add a lemon glaze which all loved. Big hit! I can’t wait for an excuse to make it again.
I loved it I wouldn’t change it at all
Adding a little lemon zest and some vanilla extract brings out the flavor.
Easy to follow directions!!! The whole family loved it. Even my Mom!!! I’ll definitely make this again!!!
Love this recipe!
I will definitely make this again. It's the best pound cake recipe that I've ever used and I've tried plenty. The only thing I added was 2 teaspoon of pure vanilla.
Really tasty .. ! like to prepare it again.
It was amazing! I topped it with whipped cream and strawberry’s which really made it. Highly recommend it for the family!
Love love love it, rich and delicious.... I did and vanilla paste
Love love love it, rich and delicious.... I did and vanilla paste
I didn't change any thing
made it and was awesome. family and friends loved it. added lemon glaze on it.

This pound cake was excellent. We enjoyed it with some fresh Florida strawberries and whipped cream. A perfect dessert! I followed the recipe exactly - you really have to take the time to cream the sugar and butter...and even more time mixing after adding each egg. A little time consuming, but worth every bite!
Easy to make, had all ingredients on hand. I mixed blackberries into the mix and served warm with ice cream...loved by everyone. Had for breakfast the next day and it was gone.
I made this cake as is, and it was wonderful
